pros: good atmosphere and people all around

pros: Fantastic full-time staff; Flexible hours; Family-like atmosphere; I felt like I could bring my creativity to the job

pros: Most of the people were great to work and interact with. Very diverse staff.
cons: Low pay and no overtime. No room for growth.

pros: Got to build relationships with students and develop a better understanding of each subject that I tutored a student in.
cons: Pay structure was garbage, each session only lasted 30 minutes but you get paid by the hour, really didn't appreciate waiting 5 hours for a 30 minute session to get paid $4.  Also, management would get upset if I worked more than my "scheduled hours" or tutored students who didn't sign up for a session.  I would often get reprimanded by management for not following protocol but even after I would ask what protocol was I would get no answer.

review_title: Great people but lacking support and facilities
pros:
The students, professors and staff are what makes Trinity great. They value spiritual and community growth.  It's also their selling point. I have worked in 3 other Christian universities and I would say that spiritual and community growth isn't unique to just this place.
Good place to work if you are satisfied with life around the area, but it definitely lacks advancement in career. A lot of apathetic workers. Some staff are ambitious but often burnt out due to lack of support. Better suited for those who are edging toward retirement.
cons:
- What kind of college doesn't provide a gym/rec center for average students? no 1 complain I heard everyday was, there is nothing to do on campus.
- retirement and health insurance benefits are below average.
- lack of funding in all departments. Budget cuts every year causes high stress.
- facilities and infrastructure support are poor and little fund to help fix/renovate. The worse was facility services management. If something breaks, be prepared to fix it yourself because it will take them several "ticket order" before they resolve the problems. If you get a work computer, be prepared to use a former employee's user account for the next 6-9 months before the IT guy comes and wipe it clean.

review_title: Good mission but limited vision and capacity
pros: TIU has a powerful mission and attracts some great people as students and employees. The conversations and academic thinking are first-rate.
cons: Pay is a significant challenge if you're not single. Also the structures for creativity and innovation are very limited along with limited financial investments in going beyond traditional academic structures.

review_title: One Step Forward, Two Steps Back
pros: The students, the University is poised for growth
cons: Lack of grace and an overabundance of arrogance set in the midst of many silos

pros: The administration was supportive, and the students were highly motivated.
